did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: New York and Vermont coining enterprise indentures,
did.abstract: Two indentures relating to the making of coins.
did.physloc: Rare Book Room - U.S. General - N498

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: One indenture of Samuel Atlee, James F. Atlee, David Brooks, James Grier, and James Giles for the manufacture of hardware in New York State, possibly for coins at Thomas Machin's mill (April 18, 1787), and one indenture also including Reuben Harmon, William Coley (or Cooley), Elias Jackson, and Daniel Van Voorhis for the manufacture of copper coins for the state of Vermont (June 7, 1787).
